intro: Echites nobilis, commonly known as the noble echites, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a circular pattern. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Echites nobilis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to various climates.
